Question
========

Suppose a class contains 40 students. Of these, 3 students are left-handed. The teacher wants to randomly select two students, each of whom must answer a question. What is then the probability that the teacher will choose the second choose a left-handed student, given that the first student is also left-handed is left-handed?

* 3/40
* 2/39
* 2/43
* 6/1560
